entries.title: For A New Liberty
entries.author: Murray N. Rothbard
entries.blurb: The libertarian manifesto. Rothbard systematically applies property rights and non-aggression to every area of society—radical, uncompromising, and thrilling to read.

entries.title: Seeing Like a State
entries.author: James C. Scott
entries.blurb: Essential reading for anyone interested in governance. Scott's concept of 'metis' and critique of high-modernist planning is profound.

entries.title: Stubborn Attachments
entries.author: Tyler Cowen
entries.blurb: The moral case for economic growth as a near-sacred duty. Cowen argues that maximizing sustainable growth is the most ethical thing we can do for future generations—a belief I hold deeply.

entries.title: The 10,000 Year Explosion
entries.author: Gregory Cochran & Henry Harpending
entries.blurb: Demolishes the idea that human evolution stopped 50,000 years ago. Cochran and Harpending show how agriculture accelerated genetic change—provocative and rigorous.

entries.title: The Problem of Political Authority
entries.author: Michael Huemer
entries.blurb: A rigorous philosophical examination of why governments claim authority and whether those claims are justified. Changed how I think about legitimacy.

entries.title: Your Next Government?
entries.author: Tom W. Bell
entries.blurb: The best book on special economic zones and competitive governance. Bell's legal framework for 'special jurisdictions' directly shaped my work at Próspera.

entries.title: Antifragile
entries.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
entries.blurb: Taleb's framework for things that gain from disorder. The concept of antifragility has shaped how I think about building resilient systems.

entries.title: The Machinery of Freedom
entries.author: David Friedman
entries.blurb: A practical exploration of how a stateless society might function. Friedman's economic approach to anarchism is uniquely compelling.

entries.title: A Short History of Nearly Everything
entries.author: Bill Bryson

entries.title: Against the Machine: On the Unmaking of Humanity

entries.title: The Beginning of Infinity
entries.author: David Deutsch
entries.blurb: On my list because of its exploration of the power of explanatory knowledge. Deutsch's optimism about human potential is inspiring.
